content: dagrun s luggar norwegian cabin socks by roxanne richardson this sock has a simple construction with several unusual components the sock is knit cuff down in k2p2 ribbing the heel is a version of the shaped common heel the heel flap is knit in stockinette without slipped selvedge stitches decreases on each side of the center heel are worked for several row to shape the base of the heel the turn is worked by joining the two halves of the heel stitches with a double bind off stitches are then picked up along the edges of the heel flap in order to return to working in the round for the foot there is no gusset the sock is finished with a round toe instructions for these socks were created by reverse engineering a sock knit decades ago by dagrun skårsmoen dagrun was born in 1921 and lived trøndelag norway until her death in 2012 special thanks to janne filsrand who generously lent me one of dagrun s socks so that i could uncover their hidden mysteries she tells me dagrun knit hundreds of pairs of these socks during her lifetime at its essence this sock is meant to be an easy knit that will comfortably fit a wide range of foot and leg circumferences my intent was to replicate the original socks in order to understand their construction and the techniques used particularly the double bind off under the heel i have provided tips for enlarging the socks to fit larger foot and heel diagonal circumferences at the end of the pattern dagrun s luggar norwegian cabin socks © 2023 by roxanne richardson page 1 of 6 jan 12 2023 size fits most adult ankles and feet 8-10 circumference and will accommodate a heel diagonal circumference up to 13 see notes at end of pattern about accommodating larger foot sizes and heel diagonals leg length 6 /15 cm from co edge to beginning of heel flap heel flap length including decreases 2 5 /6 3 cm total foot length 9 75 /24 75 cm adjustable toe length 2 75 /7 cm the ribbed leg has an equivalent stockinette circumference of 9 5 /24 cm which stretches to about 13 when relaxed the ribbed leg contracts to about 6 1/2 /16 5cm in circumference gauge 20 sts and 28 rnds rnds over 4 /10 cm in stockinette stitch the sock is knit at a slightly firm gauge for the yarn weight materials and tools yarn 100-150 g of aran/heavy worsted weight yarn about 220-330yds/200-300m needles us 7/4 5mm needles or needles you need to get stitch gauge you can use any type of needles that you prefer for working small circumferences in the round i used a 32 circular needle and the magic loop technique but you can use a 9 circ 2 circs 3 flexi-flips 4 dpns or 5 dpns notions yarn needle locking stitch markers abbreviations bor beginning of round rhn right hand needle eor end of round round/rnds
